content: Andrea Celli Home Publications Teaching CV Group Jobs Andrea Celli Assistant Professor Department of Computing Sciences Bocconi University Email: andrea.celli2 AT unibocconi DOT it Office: 2-c1-07 Roentgen About I am an Assistant Professor in the Computing Sciences Department at Bocconi University, and a member of the theory group and of Bocconi Institute for Data Science and Analytics. Previously, I spent one year as a postdoctoral researcher with the Core Data Science team at Meta (London). I obtained my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Politecnico di Milano, where I was advised by Nicola Gatti. During my Ph.D. I was a Visiting Researcher at Carnegie Mellon University, where I was working with Tuomas Sandholm. I am a member of the ELLIS Society. My research focuses on problems at the intersection of computer science, machine learning, and economics. Iâ€™m broadly interested in studying computational problems arising from strategic interactions, with a focus on online settings where learning processes and incentives are fundamentally intertwined. My research was awarded a best paper award at NeurIPS 2020. My research is supported by an ERC Starting Grant (2024) for the project PLA-STEER, and by a MUR-PRIN grant (2022).
